Proposal.title: Proposal
Proposal.description: Represents the proposal settings and personalization details.

yourName.description: The name of the user making the proposal.

partnerName.description: The name of the user's partner.

message.description: The custom message the user wants to display during the proposal.

theme.description: The selected visual theme for the proposal.

images.description: A list of images with captions for the proposal slideshow.

createdAt.description: The server timestamp of when the proposal was created.

DecisionHistory.title: DecisionHistory
DecisionHistory.description: Records the history of 'Yes' or 'No' button presses to influence future AI button behavior.

id.description: Unique identifier for the DecisionHistory entity.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the button press event.

xPosition.description: The X coordinate of button press (for AI to learn click patterns).

yPosition.description: The Y coordinate of button press (for AI to learn click patterns).

definition.description: Stores public proposal data. This collection is readable by anyone with the link.

params.name: proposalId
params.description: The unique ID of the proposal.

definition.description: Stores the history of button presses for machine learning purposes.

params.name: decisionHistoryId
params.description: The unique ID of the decision history record.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for a publicly shareable proposal experience. The '/proposals' collection is world-readable to allow anyone with a link to view the proposal. Writes are restricted to authenticated users (including anonymous ones who are signed in automatically) to prevent unauthorized creation. This public data model is simpler and more appropriate for shareable content than a strict user-owned data model. The DecisionHistory collection remains a write-only drop-box for analytics.
